<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/09/twitter-reports-solid-quarter-growth-challenges-remain?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When Will Twitter Leave Its Nest?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Twitter" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85OS90d2l0dGVyX2JpcmQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Without Twitter we wouldn’t have Bernie memes, dogecoin at record highs, or something to do while “watching” TV. But, as the company’s <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/twitter-racks-up-its-second-1-billion-quarter-11612905659?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earnings report</a> revealed yesterday, it still has a long way to go to compete with the giants of social media from a business standpoint. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twitter recorded quarterly revenue of more than $1 billion for the second time in Q4, up 28% from last year. Daily active users <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/09/twitter-twtr-q4-2020-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped 27%</a> to 192 million (slightly short of expectations). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So Twitter’s growing...but it’s still tiny</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With a market valuation of ~$48 billion, Twitter is worth 6% of Facebook, which pulled in about 28x as much revenue as Twitter last quarter. And while Twitter pays the bills exclusively through advertising, it accounts for just 0.8% of the global digital advertising market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Writing in New York Magazine, Big Tech critic Prof. Scott Galloway made the case for booting CEO Jack Dorsey and <a href="https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2021/02/capitalist-case-for-overhauling-twitter.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overhauling Twitter</a>, which he called a “terribly run company.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The day it IPO’d in 2013, Twitter’s stock price closed at $44.90; it closed at $59.87 yesterday. That’s not something you brag about with a “How it started…” post. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But there are signs of life</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Long criticized for failing to innovate on its product experience, Twitter has recently...tried to <a href="https://notboring.substack.com/p/how-twitter-got-its-groove-back?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">innovate</a>. It launched an audio-based platform called Spaces (which will compete with Clubhouse), and acquired Revue, a company in the most booming industry of all: newsletters.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even spicier, it’s reportedly <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-08/twitter-considers-subscription-fee-for-tweetdeck-unique-content?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">building</a> a highly anticipated subscription service to diversify away from its purely advertising-based revenue model. One paid approach may allow users to “tip” people they follow for access to exclusive content.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Almost one year ago, Twitter <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/09/twitter-strikes-investment-deal-with-elliott-management-silver-lake-after-attempt-to-oust-ceo-jack-dorsey.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reached a deal</a> with activist investors who wanted to oust Dorsey from his position. Dorsey’s still here...but he has a lot to prove. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/09/covid-roundup-us-attitudes-toward-vaccination-improve-chinas-births-fall?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Covid Around the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Coronavirus" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NzIvY29yb25hdmlydXMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's been 334 days since we last wore jeans. What's the latest news on Covid-19?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Virus: </strong>The WHO team probing the coronavirus's origins said it was "<a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/who-s-covid-mission-china-give-first-report-n1257105?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extremely unlikely</a>" the virus leaked from a lab, and more likely that it jumped from an animal species to humans.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vaccines: </strong>The number of US adults willing to get vaccinated <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/more-americans-say-they-re-willing-get-covid-vaccine-cdc-n1257152?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a> from September to December...but was still <50%, the CDC reported. Yesterday, a Walgreens exec <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/09/covid-vaccine-60percent-of-nursing-home-staff-refused-shots-walgreens-exec-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> ~60% of nursing home staff and 20% of residents have declined shots. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Births: </strong>In China, registered births <a href="https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3121112/china-birth-rate-population-concerns-grow-number-registered?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell</a> 15% last year, according to government data. Although Beijing dropped its one-child policy in 2015, births have continued falling since then and additional declines from the pandemic could place more stress on China's workforce and healthcare and pension systems down the line. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The US is also </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/covid19-baby-bust-us-see-500k-fewer-births-next-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">projected</a></span><span> to have a "birth bust" of 300,000 fewer babies this year.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Travel: </strong>To keep highly contagious variants out, Britain <a href="https://apnews.com/article/travel-public-health-england-coronavirus-pandemic-235266506addd34b637a67db545ec3f6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will require</a> international travelers arriving from countries on its watch list to pay $2,400 for a 10-day hotel quarantine. Lying or breaking the rules could incur fines up to $14,000 or 10 years in prison. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/09/uae-satellite-enters-mars-orbit-means?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mars Braces for Holiday Weekend Traffic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The planet Mars surrounded by roads " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDA0L21hcnNfcm9hZHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday morning, the United Arab Emirates's spacecraft, al-Amal (meaning "Hope"), <a href="https://www.axios.com/united-arab-emirates-china-mars-missions-7fe67bb9-62e9-40f8-b505-d0666988b97a.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">entered</a> a stable orbit around our galactic neighbor, Mars. China's Tianwen-1 spacecraft is expected to join it today, and the US's Perseverance rover is slated for a Feb. 18 touchdown on the planet's surface. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The nifty science-museum details: </strong>From its equatorial orbit, the UAE's satellite will scan the entire surface of Mars every nine days, per mission officials. To reach orbit, the SUV-sized spacecraft used onboard autonomous computers, since the 22-minute time-lag between it and Earth means ground control is impossible. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The geopolitical backstory: </strong>The satellite is part of the UAE's effort to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-a-e-s-hope-mars-mission-signals-new-era-of-global-space-exploration-11612875601?mod=hp_lead_pos11&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">transition its economy</a> away from oil and toward science and tech, in case oil prices top out. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Space is where countries project what IR majors call "soft power"—showing off their technological abilities as a means of juicing their standing among allies and rivals. </p>

</h3>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The other day, we were chatting with a pal who told us he thought “all forms were boring.” After we spat out our coffee, we looked that chap right in the eye and told him how wrong he was. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“My friend,” we said, “you have clearly never interacted with <a href="https://www.typeform.com/?utm_campaign=Feb10&utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=paid&utm_content=Primary" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Typeform, the insanely versatile form builder</a> that <strong style="color:#000">helps your biz create forms</strong> which scoff at the very concept of ‘boring.’”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“We are trying not to lose our temper at your ignorance of Typeform’s glory, but we are <em>flabbergasted</em> that you’ve never encountered Typeform’s beautiful <strong style="color:#000">customizable interface</strong>, which allows you to <strong style="color:#000">fully customize your form to match your brand</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Kind sir, there’s almost nothing you <em>can’t </em>do with Typeform. <strong style="color:#000">Feedback</strong>. <strong style="color:#000">Lead gen</strong>. <strong style="color:#000">Market research</strong>. <strong style="color:#000">Surveys</strong>. <strong style="color:#000">Event sign-up</strong>. Heck, you can <strong style="color:#000">sell stuff</strong>. And every Typeform gives your user a <strong style="color:#000">people-friendly, conversational experience</strong>.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s when our friend looked at us, a twinkle in his eye, and said, “I’ll <a href="https://www.typeform.com/?utm_campaign=Feb10&utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=paid&utm_content=Primary" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">start using Typeform right away.”</a></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EXPLAINER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/09/treasury-department-federal-reserve?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reader Question: Fed vs. Treasury
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bank" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTM2L2ZlZGVyYWxfcmVzZXJ2ZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every Wednesday, we answer a reader-submitted question about business and the economy. Got something to ask us? </em><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Click here</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">From Judy B. in Boston: </strong>Please explain the difference between the Treasury Department and the Federal Reserve. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Brew's answer: </strong>Thanks for asking so politely. Generally speaking, the Treasury enacts fiscal policy (i.e., taxation and spending policies set by Congress), while the Fed handles monetary policy (which affects the money supply). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let's start with the Treasury, which <a href="https://www.thebalance.com/u-s-department-of-treasury-what-it-does-and-its-effect-3305998?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">manages</a> the US' finances. It collects taxes, print money, enforce finance laws, manage public debt, oversee national banks, and even regulate the alcohol industry. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The department is headed by Secretary Janet Yellen, who is an important economic advisor to the president and has accomplished enough to get her own </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12NEKj9Z3hA&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Hamilton</em>-style rap</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Treasury in action:</strong> When Congress passed the CARES Act, the Treasury <a href="https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/cares?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was responsible</a> for sending direct payments to individuals, doling out PPP funds, providing rental assistance, and helping out struggling state and local governments.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now do the Fed </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chaired by Jerome Powell, the Federal Reserve <a href="https://www.stlouisfed.org/open-vault/2018/october/difference-between-fiscal-monetary-policy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has</a> a "dual mandate" to pursue maximum employment and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/feds-new-inflation-strategy-matters?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">price stability</a>. It can do that by setting interest rates, buying/selling government bonds, and changing how much money banks must keep in their reserves. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Fed in action:</strong> To keep markets stable during Covid, the Fed <a href="https://www.stlouisfed.org/open-vault/2020/august/fed-response-covid19-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bought</a> a lot of government bonds and mortgage-backed securities to inject cash into the economy. It lowered interest rates to near-zero to reduce borrowing costs for households and businesses, and even set up limited emergency lending programs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hope that helps! Feel free to <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ask more questions here</a>.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/09/gathering-restrictions-weigh-super-bowl-ratings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Network Execs Looking at Super Bowl Ratings
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="The Weeknd making a grimacing face " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=425 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/LqlcgZF8wjLdrv8Mr0/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="The Weeknd making a grimacing face " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/LqlcgZF8wjLdrv8Mr0/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This year's Super Bowl viewing numbers <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/09/media/super-bowl-ratings-2021/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were much like</a> Patrick Mahomes: incredibly impressive in general, but bested by older peers. Including both traditional TV and streaming platforms, about 96 million people watched the game, per CBS, which is a 5.5% drop from last year and the smallest Super Bowl audience since 2007. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why? </strong>Closed bars and restaurants, plus smaller gatherings, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/super-bowl-draws-lowest-audience-since-2007-11612880203?mod=hp_lista_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">meant fewer</a> "passive viewers," or people who watch the Super Bowl for the wings and dip, rather than for the football. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus...for networks as well as the rest of us, it's annoying that Tom Brady is as good as he is. With Brady's Bucs already ahead by 15 points at halftime, the game wasn't particularly close, which drags on ratings. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One bright spot: The streaming audience was up 65% from last year at 5.7 million viewers per minute. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Each year, broadcast networks CBS, NBC, and Fox <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-09/super-bowl-audience-plunges-to-96-million-across-platforms?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pass</a> the big game around like a profit-printing pigskin. By carrying the first—and hopefully only—Covid-era Super Bowl, CBS pulled the short straw. </p>

Democrats are hoping to bar Trump from ever holding public office again. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, President Biden met with \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/09/business/president-biden-meets-with-top-ceos-as-he-pushes-for-a-1-9-trillion-aid-package.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etop business leaders\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, including the CEOs of JPMorgan and Walmart, to chat about his economic policy and his $1.9 trillion stimulus plan.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe 1959–1966 Celtics championship run lives another day. style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/09/twitter-reports-solid-quarter-growth-challenges-remain?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhen Will Twitter Leave Its Nest?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Twitter\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85OS90d2l0dGVyX2JpcmQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWithout Twitter we wouldn’t have Bernie memes, dogecoin at record highs, or something to do while “watching” TV. But, as the company’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/twitter-racks-up-its-second-1-billion-quarter-11612905659?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearnings report\u003c/a\u003e revealed yesterday, it still has a long way to go to compete with the giants of social media from a business standpoint. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwitter recorded quarterly revenue of more than $1 billion for the second time in Q4, up 28% from last year. Daily active users \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/09/twitter-twtr-q4-2020-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped 27%\u003c/a\u003e to 192 million (slightly short of expectations). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo Twitter’s growing...but it’s still tiny\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith a market valuation of ~$48 billion, Twitter is worth 6% of Facebook, which pulled in about 28x as much revenue as Twitter last quarter. And while Twitter pays the bills exclusively through advertising, it accounts for just 0.8% of the global digital advertising market. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWriting in New York Magazine, Big Tech critic Prof. Scott Galloway made the case for booting CEO Jack Dorsey and \u003ca href=\"https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2021/02/capitalist-case-for-overhauling-twitter.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoverhauling Twitter\u003c/a\u003e, which he called a “terribly run company.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe day it IPO’d in 2013, Twitter’s stock price closed at $44.90; it closed at $59.87 yesterday. That’s not something you brag about with a “How it started…” post. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut there are signs of life\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLong criticized for failing to innovate on its product experience, Twitter has recently...tried to \u003ca href=\"https://notboring.substack.com/p/how-twitter-got-its-groove-back?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einnovate\u003c/a\u003e. It launched an audio-based platform called Spaces (which will compete with Clubhouse), and acquired Revue, a company in the most booming industry of all: newsletters.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven spicier, it’s reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-08/twitter-considers-subscription-fee-for-tweetdeck-unique-content?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuilding\u003c/a\u003e a highly anticipated subscription service to diversify away from its purely advertising-based revenue model. One paid approach may allow users to “tip” people they follow for access to exclusive content.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAlmost one year ago, Twitter \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/09/twitter-strikes-investment-deal-with-elliott-management-silver-lake-after-attempt-to-oust-ceo-jack-dorsey.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereached a deal\u003c/a\u003e with activist investors who wanted to oust Dorsey from his position. Dorsey’s still here...but he has a lot to prove. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's been 334 days since we last wore jeans. What's the latest news on Covid-19?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVirus: \u003c/strong\u003eThe WHO team probing the coronavirus's origins said it was \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/who-s-covid-mission-china-give-first-report-n1257105?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eextremely unlikely\u003c/a\u003e\" the virus leaked from a lab, and more likely that it jumped from an animal species to humans.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVaccines: \u003c/strong\u003eThe number of US adults willing to get vaccinated \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/more-americans-say-they-re-willing-get-covid-vaccine-cdc-n1257152?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose\u003c/a\u003e from September to December...but was still \u003c50%, the CDC reported. Yesterday, a Walgreens exec \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/09/covid-vaccine-60percent-of-nursing-home-staff-refused-shots-walgreens-exec-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e ~60% of nursing home staff and 20% of residents have declined shots. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBirths: \u003c/strong\u003eIn China, registered births \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3121112/china-birth-rate-population-concerns-grow-number-registered?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell\u003c/a\u003e 15% last year, according to government data. Although Beijing dropped its one-child policy in 2015, births have continued falling since then and additional declines from the pandemic could place more stress on China's workforce and healthcare and pension systems down the line. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe US is also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/covid19-baby-bust-us-see-500k-fewer-births-next-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprojected\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to have a \"birth bust\" of 300,000 fewer babies this year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTravel: \u003c/strong\u003eTo keep highly contagious variants out, Britain \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/travel-public-health-england-coronavirus-pandemic-235266506addd34b637a67db545ec3f6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill require\u003c/a\u003e international travelers arriving from countries on its watch list to pay $2,400 for a 10-day hotel quarantine. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday morning, the United Arab Emirates's spacecraft, al-Amal (meaning \"Hope\"), \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/united-arab-emirates-china-mars-missions-7fe67bb9-62e9-40f8-b505-d0666988b97a.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eentered\u003c/a\u003e a stable orbit around our galactic neighbor, Mars. China's Tianwen-1 spacecraft is expected to join it today, and the US's Perseverance rover is slated for a Feb. 18 touchdown on the planet's surface. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe nifty science-museum details: \u003c/strong\u003eFrom its equatorial orbit, the UAE's satellite will scan the entire surface of Mars every nine days, per mission officials. To reach orbit, the SUV-sized spacecraft used onboard autonomous computers, since the 22-minute time-lag between it and Earth means ground control is impossible. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe geopolitical backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe satellite is part of the UAE's effort to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-a-e-s-hope-mars-mission-signals-new-era-of-global-space-exploration-11612875601?mod=hp_lead_pos11\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etransition its economy\u003c/a\u003e away from oil and toward science and tech, in case oil prices top out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Space is where style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nReader Question: Fed vs. Treasury\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Bank\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTM2L2ZlZGVyYWxfcmVzZXJ2ZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eEvery Wednesday, we answer a reader-submitted question about business and the economy. Got something to ask us? \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eClick here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrom Judy B. in Boston: \u003c/strong\u003ePlease explain the difference between the Treasury Department and the Federal Reserve. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Brew's answer: \u003c/strong\u003eThanks for asking so politely. Generally speaking, the Treasury enacts fiscal policy (i.e., taxation and spending policies set by Congress), while the Fed handles monetary policy (which affects the money supply). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet's start with the Treasury, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.thebalance.com/u-s-department-of-treasury-what-it-does-and-its-effect-3305998?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emanages\u003c/a\u003e the US' finances. It collects taxes, print money, enforce finance laws, manage public debt, oversee national banks, and even regulate the alcohol industry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe department is headed by Secretary Janet Yellen, who is an important economic advisor to the president and has accomplished enough to get her own \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12NEKj9Z3hA\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHamilton\u003c/em\u003e-style rap\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Treasury in action:\u003c/strong\u003e When Congress passed the CARES Act, the Treasury \u003ca href=\"https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/cares?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas responsible\u003c/a\u003e for sending direct payments to individuals, doling out PPP funds, providing rental assistance, and helping out struggling state and local governments.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow do the Fed \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChaired by Jerome Powell, the Federal Reserve \u003ca href=\"https://www.stlouisfed.org/open-vault/2018/october/difference-between-fiscal-monetary-policy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas\u003c/a\u003e a \"dual mandate\" to pursue maximum employment and \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/feds-new-inflation-strategy-matters?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprice stability\u003c/a\u003e. It can do that by setting interest rates, buying/selling government bonds, and changing how much money banks must keep in their reserves. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Fed in action:\u003c/strong\u003e To keep markets stable during Covid, the Fed \u003ca href=\"https://www.stlouisfed.org/open-vault/2020/august/fed-response-covid19-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebought\u003c/a\u003e a lot of government bonds and mortgage-backed securities to inject cash into the economy. It lowered interest rates to near-zero to reduce borrowing costs for households and businesses, and even set up limited emergency lending programs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHope that helps! Feel free to \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/J0EH3zf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis year's Super Bowl viewing numbers \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/09/media/super-bowl-ratings-2021/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere much like\u003c/a\u003e Patrick Mahomes: incredibly impressive in general, but bested by older peers. Including both traditional TV and streaming platforms, about 96 million people watched the game, per CBS, which is a 5.5% drop from last year and the smallest Super Bowl audience since 2007. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy? \u003c/strong\u003eClosed bars and restaurants, plus smaller gatherings, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/super-bowl-draws-lowest-audience-since-2007-11612880203?mod=hp_lista_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emeant fewer\u003c/a\u003e \"passive viewers,\" or people who watch the Super Bowl for the wings and dip, rather than for the football. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus...for networks as well as the rest of us, it's annoying that Tom Brady is as good as he is. With Brady's Bucs already ahead by 15 points at halftime, the game wasn't particularly close, which drags on ratings. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne bright spot: The streaming audience was up 65% from last year at 5.7 million viewers per minute. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Each year, broadcast networks CBS, NBC, and Fox \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-09/super-bowl-audience-plunges-to-96-million-across-platforms?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epass\u003c/a\u003e the big game around like a profit-printing pigskin. By carrying the first—and hopefully only—Covid-era Super Bowl, CBS pulled the short straw. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
